intro: Actinostemma, commonly known as the starwort, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that often have a white or pale yellow color. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is found in parts of Europe, Asia, and North America. Actinostemma species are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
